name: Port Noon: Occult Islands of Vespera

cards.rules_text:
Trample
When you cast The Horned-Axe, until your next turn, your life total can't change.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The Lithomachy exposed her to the horrors of extra-planer influence.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
{U}{R}, Sacrifice an unblocked attacking creature you control: Put Mother of Ants from your hand onto the battlefield tapped and attacking.
At the beginning of each of your postcombat main phases, add {R} for each 2 life your opponents have lost this turn.

Whenever you sacrifice a creature, note its name. 
Once during each of your turns, you may cast a spell from your graveyard with a name noted for cards named The Elegiast.

Haste
You may choose not to untap The Mirror-Queen during your untap step.
{U}{R}, {T}: Create a token that's a copy of target creature, except it has haste. Sacrifice it when The Mirror-Queen becomes untapped.

Lifelink
Other Vampires you control get +2/+0.
Creature tokens you control are Vampires in addition to their other types.

When this creature enters or transforms into The Witch-and-Sister, target creature you control can't be blocked this turn.
{1}{W}, {T}: Transform The Witch-and-Sister.

cards.rules_text: The Wolf Divided's power and toughness are each equal to 20 minus your life total.
cards.flavor_text: [i]When the Forge is cold, the Glory is dark, and the Wood is dust, perhaps the Wolf Divided will rest, but only until it can devour itself.[/i]

When Mirrored Wolf enters, if target opponent controls no basic lands, put a +1/+1 counter on Mirrored Wolf.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The house of the Moon is empty and still, but it is home for those who wait for the sun to be whole again. [/i]

cards.rules_text: When Banisher Priest enters, exile target creature an opponent controls until Banisher Priest leaves the battlefield.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Monsters not willing to serve shall not be permitted in the Wake.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Enchant creature

cards.flavor_text: [i]“I wish it could have been different. I wish that I could have done everything I should not.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: When Broken Sun-Servant enters, you get a Scar. [i](They're boons with “When a creature you control dies, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.”)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]The death of the Sun-in-Splendour shattered both many laylines and many wings.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever Forge Secretkeeper attacks, target creature you control gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Smiths have whispered sacred words to the iron, spoken in ritual to inspire an unmerciful change.[/i]

cards.rules_text: {1}{W}: Discard Glass Guardian: Exile the top card of your library face down. It becomes foretold. [i](Its foretell cost is its mana cost if it isn't already specified.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]From its core a light from behind the world lies, leaking from its cracks.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Iron Verdict deals 5 damage to target tapped creature.

Whenever an opponent loses life, you may return target creature card with mana value less than or equal to the life lost from your graveyard to your hand. Do this only once during each of your turns.

cards.rules_text:

• Put a +1/+1 counter on Subverted Cyprian.

cards.flavor_text: [i]When Worms take flesh, there is almost nothing to be done except destroy what remains.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]The Twins drowned at sea to ascend through the Painted River.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library if it's attacking or you control a God.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Across a bright far sea, Port Noon lies. Exiles, monsters and visionaries have long favored the waters around it.[/i]

cards.rules_text: This spell costs {2} less to cast if a creature you control dealt combat damage to a player this turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Noon has always been a place outside of the rule of the hours, and many have other beings they would like to exclude as well.[/i]

cards.rules_text: When Carapace Shearer dies, if it's not an Insect, return it to the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter. It's an Insect in addition to its other types.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Humanity was said to be hatched from the shell of the Carapace Cross, but some merely clipped their wings.[/i]

Flying
When Dry-Soul Angel enters, each player sacrifices a creature.

cards.rules_text: Destroy target creature. If you controlled a God as you cast this spell, you gain 1 life. Otherwise, you lose 3 life.

cards.flavor_text: [i]I could cut a lock of hair before I sleep, to honour a power of the Wood. In my dreams, I listened to the dead as they approached the white bone gate.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each Sanctuary you control and each Sanctuary card in your graveyard.
Ward {2} [i](Whenever this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter it unless that player pays {2}.)[/i]

Whenever Territorial Yew-Maw is dealt damage during your turn, destroy up to one target artifact or enchantment if you control Territorial Yew-Maw.
Destroy target enchantment or creature. If you control an Angel or a God, you get a Scar. [i](They're boons with “When a creature you control dies, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.”)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]Those dissatisfied with the current order are gently urged to reconsider.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When Percussigant enters, search your library and/or graveyard for a Sanctuary card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. If you searched your library this way, shuffle.
Activated abilities of Sanctuaries you control cost {1} less to activate.
Sacrifice two other Clerics: Transform this creature. Activate only as a sorcery.

[i]When a card becomes foretold its foretell cost is its mana cost if it doesn't have one. 
Lands can't have a cost and are played normally.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Destroy target creature or planeswalker with mana value 3 or less. Its controller may induct. [i](To induct, create a 0/1 Cleric creature token with “Sacrifice two other Clerics: Transform this creature.” It transforms into a 4/4 God Horror creature token that can't block.)[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]It thrives in the rhythms and chants of worship, its unending dance grows in intensity.[/i]

cards.rules_text: At the beginning of your end step, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, exile target card from a graveyard, you may have it become foretold. [i](Their foretell costs are their mana costs if they aren't already specified.)[/i]
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If it's an Angel or a God, instead put a +1/+1 counter on it and it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
As long as you control a God and Verse Illuminate is in your graveyard, it has flashback {2}{W}{W}. [i](You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]We call upon the Sun-in-Rags, to bring about a glorious ending.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flying
When you sacrifice Devoured Messenger, you may exile it. When you do, you may cast target noncreature spell with mana value 4 or less from your graveyard or hand without paying its mana cost.

Ward—Put a stun counter on three nonenchantment permanents you control. 
Whenever you sacrifice another nontoken creature, you may pay {U}. If you do, create a tapped token that's a copy of that creature, except it's 2/2 and has “When this creature becomes that target of a spell or ability, exile it.”

When Legacy of the Wheel enters, if it was cast, exile all the cards in your hand face down, then draw that many cards plus one.
Discard X cards, Sacrifice Legacy of the Wheel: Until end of turn, you may play up to X cards exiled by Legacy of the Wheel.
Target creature you control gets +1/+3 until end of turn. If you control a Sanctuary or a God, that creature also gains hexproof until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]We are shrouded with the Ivory Dove's power, there is nothing that can be taken.[/i]

When Painted Distorter enters, counter target spell if its a noncreature spell or if Painted Distorter was cast from exile.
Foretell {3}{U}{U} [i](During your turn, you may pay {2} and exile this card from your hand face down. Play it on a later turn for its foretell cost.)[/i]

Counter target permanent spell unless its controller pays {3}. If this spell was foretold, instead counter that spell, then surveil 2.
Foretell {1}{U} [i](During your turn, you may pay {2} and exile this card from your hand face down. Play it on a later turn for its foretell cost.)[/i]

Until end of turn, target creature gains “Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.”
As long as you control a God and Verse Open is in your graveyard, it has flashback {U}. [i](You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flying
At the beginning of your end step, each player sacrifices a creature. 
When you sacrifice Crowned Ghoul, you may search your library for a card named The Crowned Growth exile it. If you do, it becomes foretold. [i](Its foretell cost is its mana cost if it isn't already specified.)[/i]

Deathtouch
Whenever a creature dealt damage by The Crowned Growth this turn leaves the battlefield, its controller gets 2 poison counters.
Whenever one or more poison counters are put on a player or The Crowned Growth dies, exile up to one target creature. Its controller creates a token that's a copy of The Crowned Growth, except it isn't legendary.

Deathtouch
When Cyprian Ophiomancer enters, if you control a Sanctuary or a God, each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

Flying
When Dream Whisperer enters, search your library for a card and exile it face down. It becomes foretold. Then shuffle. [i](Its foretell cost is its mana cost if it isn't already specified.)[/i]

Reach
When Herald of Loss enters, each opponent puts a foretold card to the graveyard or discards a card.
